cluster_classes.class_description: Parent category for metallurgical structure types in steels, grouping austenitic, ferritic, and martensitic structures. Should not directly contain entities.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Austenitic, ferritic, and martensitic are metallurgical structures in steels.
remarks: This class is a parent category and should not directly contain entities; it should group the specific structure classes below.
This class is a parent grouping and should not directly contain entities; ensure it is used only as a container for the specific structure classes.
This class is a schema-level parent and should be enforced as an abstract/container class, not for direct entity assignment.

cluster_classes.class_description: Austenitic metallurgical structure found in steels, especially 300 Series stainless steels and nickel base alloys.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Austenitic, ferritic, and martensitic are metallurgical structures in steels.

members.entity_description: A type of metallurgical structure (austenite) found in 300 Series stainless steels and nickel base alloys, known for its corrosion resistance.

cluster_classes.class_description: Ferritic metallurgical structure found in carbon and low alloy steels and many 400 series stainless steels.

members.entity_description: A type of metallurgical structure (ferrite) found in carbon and low alloy steels and many 400 series stainless steels, known for its corrosion resistance.

cluster_classes.class_description: Martensitic metallurgical structure found in some stainless steels.

members.entity_description: A metallurgical structure (martensite) found in some stainless steels, known for its corrosion resistance.
